revised_title: Osmotic Pressures of Calcium Ferrocyanide Solutions: Part II
tldr: This article investigates the osmotic pressures of calcium ferrocyanide solutions and their relationship to ionization. The authors find that the osmotic equilibrium pressures of these solutions are influenced by their degree of ionization, with weaker solutions showing greater ionization. The study also explores the conductivities of these solutions and their connection to osmotic pressure and ionization.
